intro_text: r_c tracks the scent of a cougar wandering along the edge of the Pack's territory.
decline_text: r_c decides not to pursue such a dangerous creature, especially seeing as it hasn't crossed the border.

success_outcomes.text: r_c bolts back to camp, howling a warning!
s_c sets up an ambush for the wandering cougar, bloodying its snout and leading it on a wild chasing dance across the border and out of c_n territory.

{PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/don't/doesn't} feel like {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/have/has} anything like the skill or power, but s_c would give {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} life for c_n, charging in to courageously lead the cougar away from c_n territory. Each thundering thump of massive paws has to be the herald of {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} doom, each rancid breath the last thing {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}'ll ever smell, but somehow, eventually, limbs and lungs burning, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/scramble/scrambles} to refuge.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c would give {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} life to protect c_n, and as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/lead/leads} the massive feline away from the Pack, in {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} heart, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/accept/accepts} that's what {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'re/'s} doing. Miraculously {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/slip/slips} out of the cougar's claws while it pins {PRONOUN/r_c/object}, scurrying to a refuge. r_c is injured, desperate, and terrified - but {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'re/'s} alive.

intro_text: Your patrol tracks the scent of a bear, wandering along the edge of the Pack's territory.
decline_text: Your patrol decides not to pursue such a dangerous creature, especially seeing as it hasn't crossed the border.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol shadows the bear, sending a message back to warn camp. It's an exhausting and stressful day, but by the time night falls they've confirmed that the bear is leaving the local area, and the patrol has assured c_n's safety.
Your patrol gathers their courage and valiantly tries to lead away the bear. With such a small group of wolves, they can only lead it a short distance, but it's better than nothing.
s_c sets up a careful ambush ahead of the bear, and the surprising, darting attack bloodies the bear's flank, dissuading it from heading further into c_n territory.

s_c selflessly takes the lion's share of the run the patrol leads the bear on, exhausting {PRONOUN/s_c/object} almost to the point of danger, but leading the bear far away from c_n borders. {PRONOUN/s_c/poss/CAP} Packmates support {PRONOUN/s_c/object} on the long walk home once it's all over, {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} tail wagging between exhausted pants.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol tries to keep watch on the bear from a distance, but it spots the wolves and they have to scatter. Everyone escapes just fine, but they lose track of the bear. It could be anywhere still out there, lurking, waiting to attack.

s_c tries to take the lion's share of the effort to lead the bear away, but {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} strength fails {PRONOUN/s_c/object} and the rest of the patrol needs to rescue {PRONOUN/s_c/object}, cutting short the results of the patrol. Instead, everyone knows the bear could still be lurking on {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} borders.

The patrol tries to lead the bear away from the Pack's borders, but with so few wolves it's impossible to cover each other's backs. r_c falls to the bear as the rest of the patrol runs for their lives back to camp, terrified out of their pelts and mourning their Packmate.

history_text.scar: This wolf is scarred from bravely defending the Pack against a bear.
history_text.reg_death: This wolf died to keep the Pack safe from a large bear.
history_text.lead_death: died to keep c_n safe from a large bear

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol tries bravely to lead the bear away from c_n borders, but with so few wolves it's impossible to cover each other's backs. r_c gets caught while running and it's all the rest of the patrol can do to distract the bear long enough to get r_c to safety.

history_text.scar: This wolf is scarred from bravely defending the Pack against a bear.

intro_text: Your patrol stumbles across a cougar wandering in the middle of the Pack's territory.
decline_text: Your patrol decides not to pursue such a dangerous creature. c_n will just have to hope it doesn't come any nearer to camp.

success_outcomes.text: They decide that no wolf is going to be surprised by this predator again, and the patrol shadows the cougar, sending a message to warn camp. With enough wolves to keep watch, rest, track, and send messages forward and back from camp, c_n is kept safe from the cougar.

Your patrol gathers their courage and valiantly drives away the cougar. Together, working as one, and with all the strength of StarPack behind them, the patrol presses the cougar. By keeping up a series of small skirmishes through the entire day, they drive it all the way off c_n territory.

s_c has just enough time to bark out a plan, leading the whole large patrol in a skillful battle plan against the cougar that protects the wolves from the chance of injury. The cougar defensively hisses, and runs for more friendly lands.

s_c selflessly {VERB/s_c/throw/throws} {PRONOUN/s_c/object} into the fight, and every time the cougar tries to grab at {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} Packmates, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}{VERB/s_c/'re/'s} there with snapping fangs, fur puffed out to twice {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} normal size. With s_c defending {PRONOUN/s_c/object}, the patrol drives the cougar off, howling triumphantly.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol tries to keep watch on the cougar from a distance, but it spots the wolves and they have to scatter. It's not as bad as it could've been though, r_c manages to keep track of the cougar's position, and it doesn't come any further into c_n territory.

s_c tries to protect {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} Packmates, but it gets in the way of the attack. Without everyone committed to driving the cougar off, the patrol has to fall back, but {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} escape injury.

With so many wolves all working as one, the cougar started to get beaten back. But just as the tide of the fight seems about to turn, one lucky strike hits r_c, and those vicious jaws take {PRONOUN/r_c/object} to StarPack.

history_text.scar: This wolf is scarred from bravely defending the Pack against a cougar.
history_text.reg_death: This wolf died to keep the Pack safe from a cougar.
history_text.lead_death: died to keep c_n safe from a cougar

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol fights bravely, but you only need to be unlucky once. r_c gets taken out of the fight with one snap of the beast's huge jaws. The rest of the patrol rallies to defend {PRONOUN/r_c/object}, and r_c is safely helped back to camp, where the medicine den awaits.

history_text.scar: This wolf is scarred from bravely defending the Pack against a dog.
history_text.reg_death: This wolf died to keep the Pack safe from a large dog.
history_text.lead_death: died to keep c_n safe from a large dog

intro_text: Your patrol comes across a small dog.
decline_text: The patrol decides not to pursue the dog.

success_outcomes.text: r_c snarls at the dog, warning it off. It skitters back, yapping loudly but headed in the right direction. Maybe {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} should add dog herding to {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} list of accomplishments?
r_c raises {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} tail, puffs {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} fur out to as far as it'll go, bares {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} teeth, and drives the small dog from the border.
s_c unleashes all {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} pointed fury, darting this way and that, ripping chunks of dog fur out as {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/drive/drives} it into the distance.

fail_outcomes.text: All r_c's attempts to drive the small dog off only send it into greater and greater fits of excitement, until the only thing to do is wait miserably and humiliatingly in a safe spot until the tiny heathen calms down.

The animal is far more tenacious and battle-hardened than r_c ever expected, and once the fight starts, there's no escaping from it. As r_c's world goes dark, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/have/has} {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} fangs sunk in the dog's throat. At least {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}'ll take the spicy tiny heathen with {PRONOUN/r_c/object}.

history_text.scar: This wolf got a scar from a fight with a small dog, but they always say it was a huge bear.
history_text.reg_death: This wolf was killed in a fight with a small dog, but they took the dog out with them.
history_text.lead_death: killed in a fight with a small dog

fail_outcomes.text: Small, yappy, but. . . still a dog. r_c peers out from a bush where the animal has pinned {PRONOUN/r_c/object}, wincing in pain. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} won't underestimate these ugly creatures again.

history_text.scar: This wolf got a scar from a fight with a small dog, but they always say it was a huge bear.
history_text.reg_death: This wolf was killed in a fight with a small dog, but they took the dog out with them.
history_text.lead_death: killed in a fight with a small dog

intro_text: Your patrol comes across a small dog, right on the border of c_n territory.
decline_text: p_l decides not to pursue the dog, instead cutting the patrol short to head back to camp and report it.

success_outcomes.text: p_l snarls at the small dog, and the rest of {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} small team back {PRONOUN/p_l/object} up. The dog skitters back, yapping loudly, apparently shocked by the display, and the patrol breaks out into growls and high-pitched barks, screaming until the small beast's nerve breaks, and it runs from the c_n border into the distance.

The patrol paces towards the small dog, fangs bared, hackles up, backed up with the fury of their Packmates. The dog breaks into a barking fit, but that's their opportunity to attack, covering each other as they push the creature away from their lands.

s_c calls out a battle plan, and the wolves flow into it, carefully covering each other and driving the dog backwards until its nerve breaks, it tucks tail, and it runs from c_n territory headed deep into the wilderness.

fail_outcomes.text: All r_c's attempts to drive the small dog off only send it into greater and greater fits of excitement, until the only thing to do is wait exasperatedly in a safe spot until the tiny heathen calms down.
The dog gets a lucky hit in on r_c, though together all the wolves are still able to drive it off successfully.

history_text.scar: This wolf got a scar from a fight with a small dog, but they always say it was a huge bear.

Mobbed by wolves and near blind with the blood in its eyes, the dog flees from c_n, yelping pitifully.
